reviews.text: My husband and 2 kids (10, 5) stayed a week at this hotel for the first time in mid-December 2004. For a pricey ocean view room, we got less of the ocean and more of the patio/pool. The room was large; however, the furniture and carpeting were pretty worn out and dirty. The kitchenette was a nice feature, but we couldn't really use it because there were too many roaches. The breakfast buffet was okay, but the food was a little on the pale side (not very appealing). Otherwise, everything else was fine. This was the third time I've been to Maui. Unfortunately, this resort fell short of my expectations.
reviews.title: Slightly Disappointing
Great Value, Great Location
reviews.text: My family stayed in 2 timeshare units January 2-9, 2005. We loved the large suites -- bathrooms are oversized and feature separate toilet room and two vanities - a plus for families. We had a very nice view of the ocean & Molokai from the spacious lanai. Weekly breakfast buffet is extra $85 per suite (up to 4 persons) it was abundant but not extraordinary, consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes or french toast, pototoes, baked goods, fresh fruits and yogurt, cold cereal. The 60' pool slide was being refinished and scheduled to reopen on 1/9. The daily hosted happy hour from 4-6 pm was a pleasant break before heading out on the evening's activities -- drinks available are Mai-Tais, Margaritas, Rum Punch, wine and beer, no blended drinks -- they offer something similar to party-mix for munchies. We ate one evening at the Ohana Grill which featured burgers, pizza and the like and live music. The staff here seems friendly, professional and service-oriented. When we arrived at the property it was shortly before the published check-in time and only one of our units was ready for us but we were given access to it immediately. Our second unit was ready approximately 1-1/2 hours after the stated check-in time -- we were offered another unit which we declined -- the property furnished us with a $50 dining certificate and waived the parking fees for both our vehicles. There is a narrowish beach adjoining the pool area -- Finding a pool lounge either by the pool or by the beach and some shade wasn't a problem -- towels are avail on loan (snorkeling equipment seemed expensive, though $12/day). Wear reef shoes for the ocean since there is a lot of coral and rocky surfaces --supposed to be good snorkeling spot. Its also a great place to watch the acrobatic kite-surfers when the wind is blowing right. There is a game room located below-grade near the garage entrance-- it seemed remote -- I wouldn't send my kids down there to play alone. The minature golf course looks lame. Aside from those small negatives -- it was a really nice property.

reviews.title: Try it you'll like it
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Resort December 1-10. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The suite we had was very spacious, clean and up to date. The resturant and breakfast bar was good and not too expensive. The pool was nice and big. The concierge went out of their way to help us plan our adventures while we were there and we were also given some discounts. We were able to check in early and still get an ocean view room. We would definitely go back again. Just remember when you read someone's review don't let their opinion sway you. When I read some of the reviews, I was somewhat nervous about staying at the Embassy but I'm so glad we did. We didn't regret our decision at all.

reviews.title: excellent place to stay
reviews.text: my wife and I stayed there two times now and loved it. a little bit pricy , but very nice, left a very good impression on us. close to everything.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Maui over the Thanksgiving holiday and had a great time. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but were very pleased with the room, food, service, pool, beach, etc. Our room was on the 9th floor and we were told it had not been renovated yet. I would love to see the renovated rooms because ours was great before renovation. If you expect the Ritz-Carlton you will be disappointed most places you go. Make the most of it. Yes the breakfast is a buffet, so the eggs aren't the greatest. For us the breakfast was included, so no big deal. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. All in all a great experience at the Embassy and we would definitely stay there again.
Let me start by saying that the place was absolutely beautiful. Nice grounds, facilities, service. Clientele was an the older side. I'm guessing that most of them own the timeshares in the building.

reviews.title: We love the Embassy!
reviews.text: My hubby and I just returned from a week at the Embassy, and have to say that I couldn't have stayed at the same place that the negative reviewers did! This is the second year in a row that we have stayed at the Embassy, and we love it. True, the furniture was a little on the tired side, but it is quite obvious that the whole place is in the middle of being completely renovated, so we didn't think that was a big deal - the problem is being addressed. Our impression of the staff is very favorable. They seem to be happy to be there. The North Beach Grille staff is outstanding. and the food is great. So what if you can't take your drink outside of the cocktail reception area? Hello? It's provided at no extra charge...what do you expect? And there certainly was no skimping on the alcohol! We never saw bugs in the food, nor sand in the pool, the birds are cute, and we never ever felt we were being babysat or controlled by the staff. We can't wait to go back.

reviews.title: A Great PLace To Go!
reviews.text: Just got back from my Honeymoon October 10th-17th, 2004. My husband and I loved the Embassy! I was a little concerned about going after I read some of the bad reviews prior to the trip. After seeing the hotel and experiencing it myself I am shocked at just how picky people are. We had a great time there. We stayed in a room on the 12th (top) floor. We had a deluxe ocean view suite. The view was gorgeous! We had a view of the ocean, Island of Lanai, the pool, and the countryside toward the mountains. We spent quite a bit of time on the balcony enjoying our view. The living room was great. I admit, the chairs and couch were not of the same pattern but did match in color and were quite comfortable. I can't believe anyone had actually complained about them. The kitchen was also a nice space with a good size fridge, dishwasher, microwave, & sink. We were a bit puzzled at first but the dishwasher since there was no stove to cook on but found that it was nice to not wash dishes on our honeymoon-even if we only had glasses, and lunch plates. The bedroom was spacious and well decorated. Bathroom had a shower stall, two sinks, toilet room, and whirpool bath. We enjoyed every aspect of it. We found the hotel to be quiet. We were right above the Ohana Bar area and were glad that the live music never went late and the bar closed by 10pm. The hotel staff was always curteous and friendly and always willing to help. We went to the guest services desk a few times for advice on trips and were always given excellent information. We were even steered clear of a trip that would have been a total waste. The coctail hour was great! There was live music and even a snack to go with drinks. The bartender certainly did not skimp on the alcohol. Breakfast buffet was good too. They had scrambeled eggs (every day), a meat selection (varied daily), Potatoes (varied daily), and either pancakes or french toast depending on the day. They had a daily fruit bar, cereal, and toast. I enjoyed it every day and found the varied items added the variety I needed but my husband wasnt fond of the scrambeled eggs. I must admit they were a bit runny on certain days but if you ask me its better than having dry flaky eggs. Like others, the birds were a bit annoying at times but it was nice to eat outdoors so we dealt with them. Food was always covered except for the fruit which was in a buffet stand but wasn't exactly wide open. I never saw any birds or bugs around it. We both enjoyed the pool area and I even went down the waterslide! Lounge chairs were plentiful in the sun and shade. We never had trouble finding a place to sit. The sunset torch lighting ceremony was cool. The person lighting torches was always dressed in costume and had no problem posing for photo after photo. The beach area was smaller than the ones I'm used to seeing in Florida and California but it was just the right size. We never felt crowded and found the area was always neat and clean! We had meals at both the North Beach & Ohana restaurants and loved the food at both. North beach was a bit more formal- wait staff friendly at both. My favorite meal was the Hawiian Pizza at Ohana! Traveling on the island is easy, there is one major highway and very few side streets. We traveled the north, west, and east sides. Be aware of road signs as some roads have 90 degree turns. Also note that there are few directional signs to tourist areas. We had trouble finding the "blow hole" and the Twin Falls areas but managed to use our senses and the map to get where we wanted to go. Feel free to email me with any questions.

reviews.title: Embassy Maui needs improvement
reviews.text: My wife and I recently visited the Maui Embassy and we stayed in one of the renovated rooms. i must admit, the room was very nice and we had a nice view of the beach and ocean. My main problem is with the breakfast. Becuase most of the hotels in the area are open-air, meaning birds can fly in, you would think that the Embassy staff would be sure to cover the food that they serve.....NOT!! One morning when going to breakfast in the hotel the fruit was covered with sooo many fruit flies that it grossed me out and I did not eat any. The last straw for me was shortly after eating breakfast one morning my stomach starting giving me problems and I became very nauseous after eating the eggs and pancakes. That was the last morning I ate any of the cooked foods. The rest of the days I ate packaged oatmeal and cereal for breakfast.

reviews.title: Excellent vacation
reviews.text: Great place to stay....bad place to eat!!!

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.text: This is our sixth year in West Maui and would have to say the Embassy Resort ranks as one of the top hotels to stay at. The staff was extremely well-informed and friendly, the public spaces and grounds clean and attractive, and the suites are very spacious. The resort has a much more intimate feel to it than most of the Ka'anappalli resorts. The grounds and pool open right up to the ocean, no walkway or hedge seperating the resort from the the beach. The pool is large with smaller pools for younger swimmers. The beach is narrower here than South Ka'annappalli so the ocean is much closer to the resort. Allthough a timeshare resort they don't push it. A simple no thanks on the first day and we weren't bothered for the rest of the stay. The rooms provided great views to the ocean and the bathrooms were bigger than some other full rooms that we've stayed at. Maui is great at any time of the year but even more enjoyable in the fall, which is considered the off-season. Fewer crowds and traffic, easy to get a great table in the restaurants, and the popular sights are much more accessible.

reviews.title: Under Renovations, but still good
reviews.text: We just got back from a 7 day trip to the Embassy Maui on 11/25/04 with my wife and 2 kids ages 10 and 15. Wow!! Maui, greatest island in the world. All the reviews are correct that the hotel is showing age and is currently under renovations. We were booked in a deluxe ocean view on the 3rd floor (over looking the pool area and the ocean from our balcony). They had just started renovations to the entire 4th floor. Because of the noise from the construction work, we were asked to be moved and they gave us a great corner ocean front room on the 10th floor. What a view!! We knew that we were not staying at the Hyatt or the Westin, but for the price and the size of the room (huge) we cannot complain. This is an Embassy Resort. For the people who complained in the other reviews, they must have thought they booked at the Westin and ended up at the Embassy? The resort is for families and I would be disappointed if we were on a romantic vacation. We did not spend much time at the room and only one day at the hotel beach. The location is great, just north of the Kanapanalli Resort area where the Westin, Hyatt, Marriott and Sheraton are located and just south of the Kapalua Resort area where the Ritz Carlton is located. We did not want to be in the resort compound areas and the Embassy location is outstanding. Not really walking distance to these resort areas but only a 3 minute drive. Lahania is only 5 minutes or less south. Great town!! Hundreds of restaurants and shops. Cruise ship stop.

The grounds and the pool area are nice. The pool is also showing some age, but nothing to complain about. We could always find a chair by the pool. The nightly torch lighting ceremony is a great effect. The restaurants at the Embassy are just ok. We only ate at the beach / pool cafe once. The hot buffet included with the room was nice to have, but we only used it a few times. The nightly managers cocktail party was the same. Limited drinks and cheese party mix chips. But they were included, so why complain.
reviews.title: Great Place for the whole family
Had a nice time...
reviews.text: The beach at the hotel was nice. Good reef for snorkeling and boogie boards. They also have shore diving and the typical scuba pool lessons. Plenty of rentals at the hotel for snorkeling equipment and boogie boards. We valet the car so we did not see the parking garage or have trouble parking. The embassy is within walking distance of a small strip shopping mall with Subway and grocery store. Great calm snorkeling public beach just 2 blocks south called Airport Beach with plenty of public parking. Hurdreds of great surfing beaches close by.

reviews.title: Avoid the Embassy! Spend your vacation elsewhere!!
reviews.text: All in all the Embassy is great for families with a budget and leaves extra money to spend on all the great Maui activities.
